2558#define BLOCK_CIPHER_generic_pack(nid,keylen,flags) \
2559 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic(nid,keylen,16,16,cbc,cbc,CBC,flags|EVP_CIPH_FLAG_DEFAULT_ASN1) \
2560 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic(nid,keylen,16,0,ecb,ecb,ECB,flags|EVP_CIPH_FLAG_DEFAULT_ASN1) \
2561 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic(nid,keylen,1,16,ofb128,ofb,OFB,flags|EVP_CIPH_FLAG_DEFAULT_ASN1) \
2562 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic(nid,keylen,1,16,cfb128,cfb,CFB,flags|EVP_CIPH_FLAG_DEFAULT_ASN1) \
2563 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic(nid,keylen,1,16,cfb1,cfb1,CFB,flags) \
2564 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic(nid,keylen,1,16,cfb8,cfb8,CFB,flags) \
2565 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic(nid,keylen,1,16,ctr,ctr,CTR,flags)
2566
2567static int aes_init_key(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *key,
2568 const unsigned char *iv, int enc)
2569{
2570 int ret, mode;
2571 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2572
2573 mode = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_mode(ctx);
2574 if ((mode == EVP_CIPH_ECB_MODE || mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE)
2575 && !enc) {
2576#ifdef HWAES_CAPABLE
2577 if (HWAES_CAPABLE) {
2578 ret = HWAES_set_decrypt_key(key,
2579 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2580 &dat->ks.ks);
2581 dat->block = (block128_f) HWAES_decrypt;
2582 dat->stream.cbc = NULL;
2583# ifdef HWAES_cbc_encrypt
2584 if (mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE)
2585 dat->stream.cbc = (cbc128_f) HWAES_cbc_encrypt;
2586# endif
2587 } else
2588#endif
2589#ifdef BSAES_CAPABLE
2590 if (BSAES_CAPABLE && mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE) {
2591 ret = AES_set_decrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2592 &dat->ks.ks);
2593 dat->block = (block128_f) AES_decrypt;
2594 dat->stream.cbc = (cbc128_f) bsaes_cbc_encrypt;
2595 } else
2596#endif
2597#ifdef VPAES_CAPABLE
2598 if (VPAES_CAPABLE) {
2599 ret = vpaes_set_decrypt_key(key,
2600 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2601 &dat->ks.ks);
2602 dat->block = (block128_f) vpaes_decrypt;
2603 dat->stream.cbc = mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE ?
2604 (cbc128_f) vpaes_cbc_encrypt : NULL;
2605 } else
2606#endif
2607 {
2608 ret = AES_set_decrypt_key(key,
2609 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2610 &dat->ks.ks);
2611 dat->block = (block128_f) AES_decrypt;
2612 dat->stream.cbc = mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE ?
2613 (cbc128_f) AES_cbc_encrypt : NULL;
2614 }
2615 } else
2616#ifdef HWAES_CAPABLE
2617 if (HWAES_CAPABLE) {
2618 ret = HWAES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2619 &dat->ks.ks);
2620 dat->block = (block128_f) HWAES_encrypt;
2621 dat->stream.cbc = NULL;
2622# ifdef HWAES_cbc_encrypt
2623 if (mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE)
2624 dat->stream.cbc = (cbc128_f) HWAES_cbc_encrypt;
2625 else
2626# endif
2627# ifdef HWAES_ctr32_encrypt_blocks
2628 if (mode == EVP_CIPH_CTR_MODE)
2629 dat->stream.ctr = (ctr128_f) HWAES_ctr32_encrypt_blocks;
2630 else
2631# endif
2632 (void)0; /* terminate potentially open 'else' */
2633 } else
2634#endif
2635#ifdef BSAES_CAPABLE
2636 if (BSAES_CAPABLE && mode == EVP_CIPH_CTR_MODE) {
2637 ret = AES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2638 &dat->ks.ks);
2639 dat->block = (block128_f) AES_encrypt;
2640 dat->stream.ctr = (ctr128_f) bsaes_ctr32_encrypt_blocks;
2641 } else
2642#endif
2643#ifdef VPAES_CAPABLE
2644 if (VPAES_CAPABLE) {
2645 ret = vpaes_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2646 &dat->ks.ks);
2647 dat->block = (block128_f) vpaes_encrypt;
2648 dat->stream.cbc = mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE ?
2649 (cbc128_f) vpaes_cbc_encrypt : NULL;
2650 } else
2651#endif
2652 {
2653 ret = AES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
2654 &dat->ks.ks);
2655 dat->block = (block128_f) AES_encrypt;
2656 dat->stream.cbc = mode == EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE ?
2657 (cbc128_f) AES_cbc_encrypt : NULL;
2658#ifdef AES_CTR_ASM
2659 if (mode == EVP_CIPH_CTR_MODE)
2660 dat->stream.ctr = (ctr128_f) AES_ctr32_encrypt;
2661#endif
2662 }
2663
2664 if (ret < 0) {
2665 EVPerr(EVP_F_AES_INIT_KEY, EVP_R_AES_KEY_SETUP_FAILED);
2666 return 0;
2667 }
2668
2669 return 1;
2670}
2671
2672static int aes_cbc_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
2673 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
2674{
2675 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2676
2677 if (dat->stream.cbc)
2678 (*dat->stream.cbc) (in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2679 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx),
2680 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx));
2681 else if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx))
2682 CRYPTO_cbc128_encrypt(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2683 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), dat->block);
2684 else
2685 CRYPTO_cbc128_decrypt(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2686 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), dat->block);
2687
2688 return 1;
2689}
2690
2691static int aes_ecb_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
2692 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
2693{
2694 size_t bl = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_block_size(ctx);
2695 size_t i;
2696 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2697
2698 if (len < bl)
2699 return 1;
2700
2701 for (i = 0, len -= bl; i <= len; i += bl)
2702 (*dat->block) (in + i, out + i, &dat->ks);
2703
2704 return 1;
2705}
2706
2707static int aes_ofb_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
2708 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
2709{
2710 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2711
2712 int num = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_num(ctx);
2713 CRYPTO_ofb128_encrypt(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2714 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), &num, dat->block);
2715 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_num(ctx, num);
2716 return 1;
2717}
2718
2719static int aes_cfb_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
2720 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
2721{
2722 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2723
2724 int num = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_num(ctx);
2725 CRYPTO_cfb128_encrypt(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2726 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), &num,
2727 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx), dat->block);
2728 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_num(ctx, num);
2729 return 1;
2730}
2731
2732static int aes_cfb8_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
2733 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
2734{
2735 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2736
2737 int num = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_num(ctx);
2738 CRYPTO_cfb128_8_encrypt(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2739 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), &num,
2740 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx), dat->block);
2741 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_num(ctx, num);
2742 return 1;
2743}
2744
2745static int aes_cfb1_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
2746 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
2747{
2748 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2749
2750 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_test_flags(ctx, EVP_CIPH_FLAG_LENGTH_BITS)) {
2751 int num = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_num(ctx);
2752 CRYPTO_cfb128_1_encrypt(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2753 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), &num,
2754 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx), dat->block);
2755 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_num(ctx, num);
2756 return 1;
2757 }
2758
2759 while (len >= MAXBITCHUNK) {
2760 int num = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_num(ctx);
2761 CRYPTO_cfb128_1_encrypt(in, out, MAXBITCHUNK * 8, &dat->ks,
2762 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), &num,
2763 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx), dat->block);
2764 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_num(ctx, num);
2765 len -= MAXBITCHUNK;
2766 out += MAXBITCHUNK;
2767 in += MAXBITCHUNK;
2768 }
2769 if (len) {
2770 int num = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_num(ctx);
2771 CRYPTO_cfb128_1_encrypt(in, out, len * 8, &dat->ks,
2772 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), &num,
2773 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx), dat->block);
2774 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_num(ctx, num);
2775 }
2776
2777 return 1;
2778}
2779
2780static int aes_ctr_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
2781 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
2782{
2783 unsigned int num = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_num(ctx);
2784 EVP_AES_KEY *dat = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_KEY,ctx);
2785
2786 if (dat->stream.ctr)
2787 CRYPTO_ctr128_encrypt_ctr32(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2788 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx),
2789 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(ctx),
2790 &num, dat->stream.ctr);
2791 else
2792 CRYPTO_ctr128_encrypt(in, out, len, &dat->ks,
2793 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx),
2794 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(ctx), &num,
2795 dat->block);
2796 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_set_num(ctx, num);
2797 return 1;
2798}
2799
2800BLOCK_CIPHER_generic_pack(NID_aes, 128, 0)
2801 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic_pack(NID_aes, 192, 0)
2802 BLOCK_CIPHER_generic_pack(NID_aes, 256, 0)
2803
2804static int aes_gcm_cleanup(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *c)
2805{
2806 EVP_AES_GCM_CTX *gctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_GCM_CTX,c);
2807 if (gctx == NULL)
2808 return 0;
2809 OPENSSL_cleanse(&gctx->gcm, sizeof(gctx->gcm));
2810 if (gctx->iv != EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(c))
2811 OPENSSL_free(gctx->iv);
2812 return 1;
2813}
2814
2815static int aes_gcm_ctrl(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *c, int type, int arg, void *ptr)
2816{
2817 EVP_AES_GCM_CTX *gctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_GCM_CTX,c);
2818 switch (type) {
2819 case EVP_CTRL_INIT:
2820 gctx->key_set = 0;
2821 gctx->iv_set = 0;
2822 gctx->ivlen = c->cipher->iv_len;
2823 gctx->iv = c->iv;
2824 gctx->taglen = -1;
2825 gctx->iv_gen = 0;
2826 gctx->tls_aad_len = -1;
2827 return 1;
2828
2829 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_SET_IVLEN:
2830 if (arg <= 0)
2831 return 0;
2832 /* Allocate memory for IV if needed */
2833 if ((arg > EVP_MAX_IV_LENGTH) && (arg > gctx->ivlen)) {
2834 if (gctx->iv != c->iv)
2835 OPENSSL_free(gctx->iv);
2836 if ((gctx->iv = OPENSSL_malloc(arg)) == NULL) {
2837 EVPerr(EVP_F_AES_GCM_CTRL, ERR_R_MALLOC_FAILURE);
2838 return 0;
2839 }
2840 }
2841 gctx->ivlen = arg;
2842 return 1;
2843
2844 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_SET_TAG:
2845 if (arg <= 0 || arg > 16 || c->encrypt)
2846 return 0;
2847 memcpy(c->buf, ptr, arg);
2848 gctx->taglen = arg;
2849 return 1;
2850
2851 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_GET_TAG:
2852 if (arg <= 0 || arg > 16 || !c->encrypt
2853 || gctx->taglen < 0)
2854 return 0;
2855 memcpy(ptr, c->buf, arg);
2856 return 1;
2857
2858 case EVP_CTRL_GCM_SET_IV_FIXED:
2859 /* Special case: -1 length restores whole IV */
2860 if (arg == -1) {
2861 memcpy(gctx->iv, ptr, gctx->ivlen);
2862 gctx->iv_gen = 1;
2863 return 1;
2864 }
2865 /*
2866 * Fixed field must be at least 4 bytes and invocation field at least
2867 * 8.
2868 */
2869 if ((arg < 4) || (gctx->ivlen - arg) < 8)
2870 return 0;
2871 if (arg)
2872 memcpy(gctx->iv, ptr, arg);
2873 if (c->encrypt && RAND_bytes(gctx->iv + arg, gctx->ivlen - arg) <= 0)
2874 return 0;
2875 gctx->iv_gen = 1;
2876 return 1;
2877
2878 case EVP_CTRL_GCM_IV_GEN:
2879 if (gctx->iv_gen == 0 || gctx->key_set == 0)
2880 return 0;
2881 CRYPTO_gcm128_setiv(&gctx->gcm, gctx->iv, gctx->ivlen);
2882 if (arg <= 0 || arg > gctx->ivlen)
2883 arg = gctx->ivlen;
2884 memcpy(ptr, gctx->iv + gctx->ivlen - arg, arg);
2885 /*
2886 * Invocation field will be at least 8 bytes in size and so no need
2887 * to check wrap around or increment more than last 8 bytes.
2888 */
2889 ctr64_inc(gctx->iv + gctx->ivlen - 8);
2890 gctx->iv_set = 1;
2891 return 1;
2892
2893 case EVP_CTRL_GCM_SET_IV_INV:
2894 if (gctx->iv_gen == 0 || gctx->key_set == 0 || c->encrypt)
2895 return 0;
2896 memcpy(gctx->iv + gctx->ivlen - arg, ptr, arg);
2897 CRYPTO_gcm128_setiv(&gctx->gcm, gctx->iv, gctx->ivlen);
2898 gctx->iv_set = 1;
2899 return 1;
2900
2901 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_TLS1_AAD:
2902 /* Save the AAD for later use */
2903 if (arg != EVP_AEAD_TLS1_AAD_LEN)
2904 return 0;
2905 memcpy(c->buf, ptr, arg);
2906 gctx->tls_aad_len = arg;
2907 {
2908 unsigned int len = c->buf[arg - 2] << 8 | c->buf[arg - 1];
2909 /* Correct length for explicit IV */
2910 if (len < EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN)
2911 return 0;
2912 len -= EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN;
2913 /* If decrypting correct for tag too */
2914 if (!c->encrypt) {
2915 if (len < EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN)
2916 return 0;
2917 len -= EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN;
2918 }
2919 c->buf[arg - 2] = len >> 8;
2920 c->buf[arg - 1] = len & 0xff;
2921 }
2922 /* Extra padding: tag appended to record */
2923 return EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN;
2924
2925 case EVP_CTRL_COPY:
2926 {
2927 EVP_CIPHER_CTX *out = ptr;
2928 EVP_AES_GCM_CTX *gctx_out = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_GCM_CTX,out);
2929 if (gctx->gcm.key) {
2930 if (gctx->gcm.key != &gctx->ks)
2931 return 0;
2932 gctx_out->gcm.key = &gctx_out->ks;
2933 }
2934 if (gctx->iv == c->iv)
2935 gctx_out->iv = out->iv;
2936 else {
2937 if ((gctx_out->iv = OPENSSL_malloc(gctx->ivlen)) == NULL) {
2938 EVPerr(EVP_F_AES_GCM_CTRL, ERR_R_MALLOC_FAILURE);
2939 return 0;
2940 }
2941 memcpy(gctx_out->iv, gctx->iv, gctx->ivlen);
2942 }
2943 return 1;
2944 }
2945
2946 default:
2947 return -1;
2948
2949 }
2950}
2951
2952static int aes_gcm_init_key(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *key,
2953 const unsigned char *iv, int enc)
2954{
2955 EVP_AES_GCM_CTX *gctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_GCM_CTX,ctx);
2956 if (!iv && !key)
2957 return 1;
2958 if (key) {
2959 do {
2960#ifdef HWAES_CAPABLE
2961 if (HWAES_CAPABLE) {
2962 HWAES_set_encrypt_key(key, ctx->key_len * 8, &gctx->ks.ks);
2963 CRYPTO_gcm128_init(&gctx->gcm, &gctx->ks,
2964 (block128_f) HWAES_encrypt);
2965# ifdef HWAES_ctr32_encrypt_blocks
2966 gctx->ctr = (ctr128_f) HWAES_ctr32_encrypt_blocks;
2967# else
2968 gctx->ctr = NULL;
2969# endif
2970 break;
2971 } else
2972#endif
2973#ifdef BSAES_CAPABLE
2974 if (BSAES_CAPABLE) {
2975 AES_set_encrypt_key(key, ctx->key_len * 8, &gctx->ks.ks);
2976 CRYPTO_gcm128_init(&gctx->gcm, &gctx->ks,
2977 (block128_f) AES_encrypt);
2978 gctx->ctr = (ctr128_f) bsaes_ctr32_encrypt_blocks;
2979 break;
2980 } else
2981#endif
2982#ifdef VPAES_CAPABLE
2983 if (VPAES_CAPABLE) {
2984 vpaes_set_encrypt_key(key, ctx->key_len * 8, &gctx->ks.ks);
2985 CRYPTO_gcm128_init(&gctx->gcm, &gctx->ks,
2986 (block128_f) vpaes_encrypt);
2987 gctx->ctr = NULL;
2988 break;
2989 } else
2990#endif
2991 (void)0; /* terminate potentially open 'else' */
2992
2993 AES_set_encrypt_key(key, ctx->key_len * 8, &gctx->ks.ks);
2994 CRYPTO_gcm128_init(&gctx->gcm, &gctx->ks,
2995 (block128_f) AES_encrypt);
2996#ifdef AES_CTR_ASM
2997 gctx->ctr = (ctr128_f) AES_ctr32_encrypt;
2998#else
2999 gctx->ctr = NULL;
3000#endif
3001 } while (0);
3002
3003 /*
3004 * If we have an iv can set it directly, otherwise use saved IV.
3005 */
3006 if (iv == NULL && gctx->iv_set)
3007 iv = gctx->iv;
3008 if (iv) {
3009 CRYPTO_gcm128_setiv(&gctx->gcm, iv, gctx->ivlen);
3010 gctx->iv_set = 1;
3011 }
3012 gctx->key_set = 1;
3013 } else {
3014 /* If key set use IV, otherwise copy */
3015 if (gctx->key_set)
3016 CRYPTO_gcm128_setiv(&gctx->gcm, iv, gctx->ivlen);
3017 else
3018 memcpy(gctx->iv, iv, gctx->ivlen);
3019 gctx->iv_set = 1;
3020 gctx->iv_gen = 0;
3021 }
3022 return 1;
3023}
3024
3025/*
3026 * Handle TLS GCM packet format. This consists of the last portion of the IV
3027 * followed by the payload and finally the tag. On encrypt generate IV,
3028 * encrypt payload and write the tag. On verify retrieve IV, decrypt payload
3029 * and verify tag.
3030 */
3031
3032static int aes_gcm_tls_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
3033 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
3034{
3035 EVP_AES_GCM_CTX *gctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_GCM_CTX,ctx);
3036 int rv = -1;
3037 /* Encrypt/decrypt must be performed in place */
3038 if (out != in
3039 || len < (EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN + EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN))
3040 return -1;
3041 /*
3042 * Set IV from start of buffer or generate IV and write to start of
3043 * buffer.
3044 */
3045 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_ctrl(ctx, ctx->encrypt ? EVP_CTRL_GCM_IV_GEN
3046 : EVP_CTRL_GCM_SET_IV_INV,
3047 EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN, out) <= 0)
3048 goto err;
3049 /* Use saved AAD */
3050 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_aad(&gctx->gcm, ctx->buf, gctx->tls_aad_len))
3051 goto err;
3052 /* Fix buffer and length to point to payload */
3053 in += EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN;
3054 out += EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN;
3055 len -= EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN + EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN;
3056 if (ctx->encrypt) {
3057 /* Encrypt payload */
3058 if (gctx->ctr) {
3059 size_t bulk = 0;
3060#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM)
3061 if (len >= 32 && AES_GCM_ASM(gctx)) {
3062 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt(&gctx->gcm, NULL, NULL, 0))
3063 return -1;
3064
3065 bulk = AES_gcm_encrypt(in, out, len,
3066 gctx->gcm.key,
3067 gctx->gcm.Yi.c, gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3068 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3069 }
3070#endif
3071 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt_ctr32(&gctx->gcm,
3072 in + bulk,
3073 out + bulk,
3074 len - bulk, gctx->ctr))
3075 goto err;
3076 } else {
3077 size_t bulk = 0;
3078#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM2)
3079 if (len >= 32 && AES_GCM_ASM2(gctx)) {
3080 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt(&gctx->gcm, NULL, NULL, 0))
3081 return -1;
3082
3083 bulk = AES_gcm_encrypt(in, out, len,
3084 gctx->gcm.key,
3085 gctx->gcm.Yi.c, gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3086 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3087 }
3088#endif
3089 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt(&gctx->gcm,
3090 in + bulk, out + bulk, len - bulk))
3091 goto err;
3092 }
3093 out += len;
3094 /* Finally write tag */
3095 CRYPTO_gcm128_tag(&gctx->gcm, out, EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN);
3096 rv = len + EVP_GCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN + EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN;
3097 } else {
3098 /* Decrypt */
3099 if (gctx->ctr) {
3100 size_t bulk = 0;
3101#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM)
3102 if (len >= 16 && AES_GCM_ASM(gctx)) {
3103 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt(&gctx->gcm, NULL, NULL, 0))
3104 return -1;
3105
3106 bulk = AES_gcm_decrypt(in, out, len,
3107 gctx->gcm.key,
3108 gctx->gcm.Yi.c, gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3109 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3110 }
3111#endif
3112 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt_ctr32(&gctx->gcm,
3113 in + bulk,
3114 out + bulk,
3115 len - bulk, gctx->ctr))
3116 goto err;
3117 } else {
3118 size_t bulk = 0;
3119#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM2)
3120 if (len >= 16 && AES_GCM_ASM2(gctx)) {
3121 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt(&gctx->gcm, NULL, NULL, 0))
3122 return -1;
3123
3124 bulk = AES_gcm_decrypt(in, out, len,
3125 gctx->gcm.key,
3126 gctx->gcm.Yi.c, gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3127 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3128 }
3129#endif
3130 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt(&gctx->gcm,
3131 in + bulk, out + bulk, len - bulk))
3132 goto err;
3133 }
3134 /* Retrieve tag */
3135 CRYPTO_gcm128_tag(&gctx->gcm, ctx->buf, EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN);
3136 /* If tag mismatch wipe buffer */
3137 if (CRYPTO_memcmp(ctx->buf, in + len, EVP_GCM_TLS_TAG_LEN)) {
3138 OPENSSL_cleanse(out, len);
3139 goto err;
3140 }
3141 rv = len;
3142 }
3143
3144 err:
3145 gctx->iv_set = 0;
3146 gctx->tls_aad_len = -1;
3147 return rv;
3148}
3149
3150static int aes_gcm_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
3151 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
3152{
3153 EVP_AES_GCM_CTX *gctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_GCM_CTX,ctx);
3154 /* If not set up, return error */
3155 if (!gctx->key_set)
3156 return -1;
3157
3158 if (gctx->tls_aad_len >= 0)
3159 return aes_gcm_tls_cipher(ctx, out, in, len);
3160
3161 if (!gctx->iv_set)
3162 return -1;
3163 if (in) {
3164 if (out == NULL) {
3165 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_aad(&gctx->gcm, in, len))
3166 return -1;
3167 } else if (ctx->encrypt) {
3168 if (gctx->ctr) {
3169 size_t bulk = 0;
3170#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM)
3171 if (len >= 32 && AES_GCM_ASM(gctx)) {
3172 size_t res = (16 - gctx->gcm.mres) % 16;
3173
3174 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt(&gctx->gcm, in, out, res))
3175 return -1;
3176
3177 bulk = AES_gcm_encrypt(in + res,
3178 out + res, len - res,
3179 gctx->gcm.key, gctx->gcm.Yi.c,
3180 gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3181 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3182 bulk += res;
3183 }
3184#endif
3185 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt_ctr32(&gctx->gcm,
3186 in + bulk,
3187 out + bulk,
3188 len - bulk, gctx->ctr))
3189 return -1;
3190 } else {
3191 size_t bulk = 0;
3192#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM2)
3193 if (len >= 32 && AES_GCM_ASM2(gctx)) {
3194 size_t res = (16 - gctx->gcm.mres) % 16;
3195
3196 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt(&gctx->gcm, in, out, res))
3197 return -1;
3198
3199 bulk = AES_gcm_encrypt(in + res,
3200 out + res, len - res,
3201 gctx->gcm.key, gctx->gcm.Yi.c,
3202 gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3203 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3204 bulk += res;
3205 }
3206#endif
3207 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_encrypt(&gctx->gcm,
3208 in + bulk, out + bulk, len - bulk))
3209 return -1;
3210 }
3211 } else {
3212 if (gctx->ctr) {
3213 size_t bulk = 0;
3214#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM)
3215 if (len >= 16 && AES_GCM_ASM(gctx)) {
3216 size_t res = (16 - gctx->gcm.mres) % 16;
3217
3218 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt(&gctx->gcm, in, out, res))
3219 return -1;
3220
3221 bulk = AES_gcm_decrypt(in + res,
3222 out + res, len - res,
3223 gctx->gcm.key,
3224 gctx->gcm.Yi.c, gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3225 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3226 bulk += res;
3227 }
3228#endif
3229 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt_ctr32(&gctx->gcm,
3230 in + bulk,
3231 out + bulk,
3232 len - bulk, gctx->ctr))
3233 return -1;
3234 } else {
3235 size_t bulk = 0;
3236#if defined(AES_GCM_ASM2)
3237 if (len >= 16 && AES_GCM_ASM2(gctx)) {
3238 size_t res = (16 - gctx->gcm.mres) % 16;
3239
3240 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt(&gctx->gcm, in, out, res))
3241 return -1;
3242
3243 bulk = AES_gcm_decrypt(in + res,
3244 out + res, len - res,
3245 gctx->gcm.key,
3246 gctx->gcm.Yi.c, gctx->gcm.Xi.u);
3247 gctx->gcm.len.u[1] += bulk;
3248 bulk += res;
3249 }
3250#endif
3251 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_decrypt(&gctx->gcm,
3252 in + bulk, out + bulk, len - bulk))
3253 return -1;
3254 }
3255 }
3256 return len;
3257 } else {
3258 if (!ctx->encrypt) {
3259 if (gctx->taglen < 0)
3260 return -1;
3261 if (CRYPTO_gcm128_finish(&gctx->gcm, ctx->buf, gctx->taglen) != 0)
3262 return -1;
3263 gctx->iv_set = 0;
3264 return 0;
3265 }
3266 CRYPTO_gcm128_tag(&gctx->gcm, ctx->buf, 16);
3267 gctx->taglen = 16;
3268 /* Don't reuse the IV */
3269 gctx->iv_set = 0;
3270 return 0;
3271 }
3272
3273}
3274
3275#define CUSTOM_FLAGS (EVP_CIPH_FLAG_DEFAULT_ASN1 \
3276 | EVP_CIPH_CUSTOM_IV | EVP_CIPH_FLAG_CUSTOM_CIPHER \
3277 | EVP_CIPH_ALWAYS_CALL_INIT | EVP_CIPH_CTRL_INIT \
3278 | EVP_CIPH_CUSTOM_COPY)
3279
3280BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 128, 1, 12, gcm, GCM,
3281 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
3282 BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 192, 1, 12, gcm, GCM,
3283 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
3284 BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 256, 1, 12, gcm, GCM,
3285 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
3286
3287static int aes_xts_ctrl(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *c, int type, int arg, void *ptr)
3288{
3289 EVP_AES_XTS_CTX *xctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_XTS_CTX,c);
3290 if (type == EVP_CTRL_COPY) {
3291 EVP_CIPHER_CTX *out = ptr;
3292 EVP_AES_XTS_CTX *xctx_out = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_XTS_CTX,out);
3293 if (xctx->xts.key1) {
3294 if (xctx->xts.key1 != &xctx->ks1)
3295 return 0;
3296 xctx_out->xts.key1 = &xctx_out->ks1;
3297 }
3298 if (xctx->xts.key2) {
3299 if (xctx->xts.key2 != &xctx->ks2)
3300 return 0;
3301 xctx_out->xts.key2 = &xctx_out->ks2;
3302 }
3303 return 1;
3304 } else if (type != EVP_CTRL_INIT)
3305 return -1;
3306 /* key1 and key2 are used as an indicator both key and IV are set */
3307 xctx->xts.key1 = NULL;
3308 xctx->xts.key2 = NULL;
3309 return 1;
3310}
3311
3312static int aes_xts_init_key(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *key,
3313 const unsigned char *iv, int enc)
3314{
3315 EVP_AES_XTS_CTX *xctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_XTS_CTX,ctx);
3316 if (!iv && !key)
3317 return 1;
3318
3319 if (key)
3320 do {
3321#ifdef AES_XTS_ASM
3322 xctx->stream = enc ? AES_xts_encrypt : AES_xts_decrypt;
3323#else
3324 xctx->stream = NULL;
3325#endif
3326 /* key_len is two AES keys */
3327#ifdef HWAES_CAPABLE
3328 if (HWAES_CAPABLE) {
3329 if (enc) {
3330 HWAES_set_encrypt_key(key,
3331 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3332 &xctx->ks1.ks);
3333 xctx->xts.block1 = (block128_f) HWAES_encrypt;
3334# ifdef HWAES_xts_encrypt
3335 xctx->stream = HWAES_xts_encrypt;
3336# endif
3337 } else {
3338 HWAES_set_decrypt_key(key,
3339 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3340 &xctx->ks1.ks);
3341 xctx->xts.block1 = (block128_f) HWAES_decrypt;
3342# ifdef HWAES_xts_decrypt
3343 xctx->stream = HWAES_xts_decrypt;
3344#endif
3345 }
3346
3347 HWAES_set_encrypt_key(key + EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) / 2,
3348 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3349 &xctx->ks2.ks);
3350 xctx->xts.block2 = (block128_f) HWAES_encrypt;
3351
3352 xctx->xts.key1 = &xctx->ks1;
3353 break;
3354 } else
3355#endif
3356#ifdef BSAES_CAPABLE
3357 if (BSAES_CAPABLE)
3358 xctx->stream = enc ? bsaes_xts_encrypt : bsaes_xts_decrypt;
3359 else
3360#endif
3361#ifdef VPAES_CAPABLE
3362 if (VPAES_CAPABLE) {
3363 if (enc) {
3364 vpaes_set_encrypt_key(key,
3365 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3366 &xctx->ks1.ks);
3367 xctx->xts.block1 = (block128_f) vpaes_encrypt;
3368 } else {
3369 vpaes_set_decrypt_key(key,
3370 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3371 &xctx->ks1.ks);
3372 xctx->xts.block1 = (block128_f) vpaes_decrypt;
3373 }
3374
3375 vpaes_set_encrypt_key(key + EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) / 2,
3376 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3377 &xctx->ks2.ks);
3378 xctx->xts.block2 = (block128_f) vpaes_encrypt;
3379
3380 xctx->xts.key1 = &xctx->ks1;
3381 break;
3382 } else
3383#endif
3384 (void)0; /* terminate potentially open 'else' */
3385
3386 if (enc) {
3387 AES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3388 &xctx->ks1.ks);
3389 xctx->xts.block1 = (block128_f) AES_encrypt;
3390 } else {
3391 AES_set_decrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3392 &xctx->ks1.ks);
3393 xctx->xts.block1 = (block128_f) AES_decrypt;
3394 }
3395
3396 AES_set_encrypt_key(key + EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) / 2,
3397 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 4,
3398 &xctx->ks2.ks);
3399 xctx->xts.block2 = (block128_f) AES_encrypt;
3400
3401 xctx->xts.key1 = &xctx->ks1;
3402 } while (0);
3403
3404 if (iv) {
3405 xctx->xts.key2 = &xctx->ks2;
3406 memcpy(EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), iv, 16);
3407 }
3408
3409 return 1;
3410}
3411
3412static int aes_xts_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
3413 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
3414{
3415 EVP_AES_XTS_CTX *xctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_XTS_CTX,ctx);
3416 if (!xctx->xts.key1 || !xctx->xts.key2)
3417 return 0;
3418 if (!out || !in || len < AES_BLOCK_SIZE)
3419 return 0;
3420 if (xctx->stream)
3421 (*xctx->stream) (in, out, len,
3422 xctx->xts.key1, xctx->xts.key2,
3423 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx));
3424 else if (CRYPTO_xts128_encrypt(&xctx->xts, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx),
3425 in, out, len,
3426 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)))
3427 return 0;
3428 return 1;
3429}
3430
3431#define aes_xts_cleanup NULL
3432
3433#define XTS_FLAGS (EVP_CIPH_FLAG_DEFAULT_ASN1 | EVP_CIPH_CUSTOM_IV \
3434 | EVP_CIPH_ALWAYS_CALL_INIT | EVP_CIPH_CTRL_INIT \
3435 | EVP_CIPH_CUSTOM_COPY)
3436
3437BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 128, 1, 16, xts, XTS, XTS_FLAGS)
3438 BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 256, 1, 16, xts, XTS, XTS_FLAGS)
3439
3440static int aes_ccm_ctrl(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *c, int type, int arg, void *ptr)
3441{
3442 EVP_AES_CCM_CTX *cctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_CCM_CTX,c);
3443 switch (type) {
3444 case EVP_CTRL_INIT:
3445 cctx->key_set = 0;
3446 cctx->iv_set = 0;
3447 cctx->L = 8;
3448 cctx->M = 12;
3449 cctx->tag_set = 0;
3450 cctx->len_set = 0;
3451 cctx->tls_aad_len = -1;
3452 return 1;
3453
3454 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_TLS1_AAD:
3455 /* Save the AAD for later use */
3456 if (arg != EVP_AEAD_TLS1_AAD_LEN)
3457 return 0;
3458 memcpy(EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(c), ptr, arg);
3459 cctx->tls_aad_len = arg;
3460 {
3461 uint16_t len =
3462 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(c)[arg - 2] << 8
3463 | EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(c)[arg - 1];
3464 /* Correct length for explicit IV */
3465 if (len < EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN)
3466 return 0;
3467 len -= EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN;
3468 /* If decrypting correct for tag too */
3469 if (!EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(c)) {
3470 if (len < cctx->M)
3471 return 0;
3472 len -= cctx->M;
3473 }
3474 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(c)[arg - 2] = len >> 8;
3475 EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(c)[arg - 1] = len & 0xff;
3476 }
3477 /* Extra padding: tag appended to record */
3478 return cctx->M;
3479
3480 case EVP_CTRL_CCM_SET_IV_FIXED:
3481 /* Sanity check length */
3482 if (arg != EVP_CCM_TLS_FIXED_IV_LEN)
3483 return 0;
3484 /* Just copy to first part of IV */
3485 memcpy(EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(c), ptr, arg);
3486 return 1;
3487
3488 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_SET_IVLEN:
3489 arg = 15 - arg;
3490 /* fall thru */
3491 case EVP_CTRL_CCM_SET_L:
3492 if (arg < 2 || arg > 8)
3493 return 0;
3494 cctx->L = arg;
3495 return 1;
3496
3497 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_SET_TAG:
3498 if ((arg & 1) || arg < 4 || arg > 16)
3499 return 0;
3500 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(c) && ptr)
3501 return 0;
3502 if (ptr) {
3503 cctx->tag_set = 1;
3504 memcpy(EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(c), ptr, arg);
3505 }
3506 cctx->M = arg;
3507 return 1;
3508
3509 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_GET_TAG:
3510 if (!EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(c) || !cctx->tag_set)
3511 return 0;
3512 if (!CRYPTO_ccm128_tag(&cctx->ccm, ptr, (size_t)arg))
3513 return 0;
3514 cctx->tag_set = 0;
3515 cctx->iv_set = 0;
3516 cctx->len_set = 0;
3517 return 1;
3518
3519 case EVP_CTRL_COPY:
3520 {
3521 EVP_CIPHER_CTX *out = ptr;
3522 EVP_AES_CCM_CTX *cctx_out = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_CCM_CTX,out);
3523 if (cctx->ccm.key) {
3524 if (cctx->ccm.key != &cctx->ks)
3525 return 0;
3526 cctx_out->ccm.key = &cctx_out->ks;
3527 }
3528 return 1;
3529 }
3530
3531 default:
3532 return -1;
3533
3534 }
3535}
3536
3537static int aes_ccm_init_key(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *key,
3538 const unsigned char *iv, int enc)
3539{
3540 EVP_AES_CCM_CTX *cctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_CCM_CTX,ctx);
3541 if (!iv && !key)
3542 return 1;
3543 if (key)
3544 do {
3545#ifdef HWAES_CAPABLE
3546 if (HWAES_CAPABLE) {
3547 HWAES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
3548 &cctx->ks.ks);
3549
3550 CRYPTO_ccm128_init(&cctx->ccm, cctx->M, cctx->L,
3551 &cctx->ks, (block128_f) HWAES_encrypt);
3552 cctx->str = NULL;
3553 cctx->key_set = 1;
3554 break;
3555 } else
3556#endif
3557#ifdef VPAES_CAPABLE
3558 if (VPAES_CAPABLE) {
3559 vpaes_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
3560 &cctx->ks.ks);
3561 CRYPTO_ccm128_init(&cctx->ccm, cctx->M, cctx->L,
3562 &cctx->ks, (block128_f) vpaes_encrypt);
3563 cctx->str = NULL;
3564 cctx->key_set = 1;
3565 break;
3566 }
3567#endif
3568 AES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
3569 &cctx->ks.ks);
3570 CRYPTO_ccm128_init(&cctx->ccm, cctx->M, cctx->L,
3571 &cctx->ks, (block128_f) AES_encrypt);
3572 cctx->str = NULL;
3573 cctx->key_set = 1;
3574 } while (0);
3575 if (iv) {
3576 memcpy(EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), iv, 15 - cctx->L);
3577 cctx->iv_set = 1;
3578 }
3579 return 1;
3580}
3581
3582static int aes_ccm_tls_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
3583 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
3584{
3585 EVP_AES_CCM_CTX *cctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_CCM_CTX,ctx);
3586 CCM128_CONTEXT *ccm = &cctx->ccm;
3587 /* Encrypt/decrypt must be performed in place */
3588 if (out != in || len < (EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN + (size_t)cctx->M))
3589 return -1;
3590 /* If encrypting set explicit IV from sequence number (start of AAD) */
3591 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx))
3592 memcpy(out, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(ctx),
3593 EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN);
3594 /* Get rest of IV from explicit IV */
3595 memcpy(EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx) + EVP_CCM_TLS_FIXED_IV_LEN, in,
3596 EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN);
3597 /* Correct length value */
3598 len -= EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN + cctx->M;
3599 if (CRYPTO_ccm128_setiv(ccm, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), 15 - cctx->L,
3600 len))
3601 return -1;
3602 /* Use saved AAD */
3603 CRYPTO_ccm128_aad(ccm, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(ctx), cctx->tls_aad_len);
3604 /* Fix buffer to point to payload */
3605 in += EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN;
3606 out += EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN;
3607 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)) {
3608 if (cctx->str ? CRYPTO_ccm128_encrypt_ccm64(ccm, in, out, len,
3609 cctx->str) :
3610 CRYPTO_ccm128_encrypt(ccm, in, out, len))
3611 return -1;
3612 if (!CRYPTO_ccm128_tag(ccm, out + len, cctx->M))
3613 return -1;
3614 return len + EVP_CCM_TLS_EXPLICIT_IV_LEN + cctx->M;
3615 } else {
3616 if (cctx->str ? !CRYPTO_ccm128_decrypt_ccm64(ccm, in, out, len,
3617 cctx->str) :
3618 !CRYPTO_ccm128_decrypt(ccm, in, out, len)) {
3619 unsigned char tag[16];
3620 if (CRYPTO_ccm128_tag(ccm, tag, cctx->M)) {
3621 if (!CRYPTO_memcmp(tag, in + len, cctx->M))
3622 return len;
3623 }
3624 }
3625 OPENSSL_cleanse(out, len);
3626 return -1;
3627 }
3628}
3629
3630static int aes_ccm_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
3631 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
3632{
3633 EVP_AES_CCM_CTX *cctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_CCM_CTX,ctx);
3634 CCM128_CONTEXT *ccm = &cctx->ccm;
3635 /* If not set up, return error */
3636 if (!cctx->key_set)
3637 return -1;
3638
3639 if (cctx->tls_aad_len >= 0)
3640 return aes_ccm_tls_cipher(ctx, out, in, len);
3641
3642 /* EVP_*Final() doesn't return any data */
3643 if (in == NULL && out != NULL)
3644 return 0;
3645
3646 if (!cctx->iv_set)
3647 return -1;
3648
3649 if (!out) {
3650 if (!in) {
3651 if (CRYPTO_ccm128_setiv(ccm, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx),
3652 15 - cctx->L, len))
3653 return -1;
3654 cctx->len_set = 1;
3655 return len;
3656 }
3657 /* If have AAD need message length */
3658 if (!cctx->len_set && len)
3659 return -1;
3660 CRYPTO_ccm128_aad(ccm, in, len);
3661 return len;
3662 }
3663
3664 /* The tag must be set before actually decrypting data */
3665 if (!EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx) && !cctx->tag_set)
3666 return -1;
3667
3668 /* If not set length yet do it */
3669 if (!cctx->len_set) {
3670 if (CRYPTO_ccm128_setiv(ccm, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx),
3671 15 - cctx->L, len))
3672 return -1;
3673 cctx->len_set = 1;
3674 }
3675 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)) {
3676 if (cctx->str ? CRYPTO_ccm128_encrypt_ccm64(ccm, in, out, len,
3677 cctx->str) :
3678 CRYPTO_ccm128_encrypt(ccm, in, out, len))
3679 return -1;
3680 cctx->tag_set = 1;
3681 return len;
3682 } else {
3683 int rv = -1;
3684 if (cctx->str ? !CRYPTO_ccm128_decrypt_ccm64(ccm, in, out, len,
3685 cctx->str) :
3686 !CRYPTO_ccm128_decrypt(ccm, in, out, len)) {
3687 unsigned char tag[16];
3688 if (CRYPTO_ccm128_tag(ccm, tag, cctx->M)) {
3689 if (!CRYPTO_memcmp(tag, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_buf_noconst(ctx),
3690 cctx->M))
3691 rv = len;
3692 }
3693 }
3694 if (rv == -1)
3695 OPENSSL_cleanse(out, len);
3696 cctx->iv_set = 0;
3697 cctx->tag_set = 0;
3698 cctx->len_set = 0;
3699 return rv;
3700 }
3701}
3702
3703#define aes_ccm_cleanup NULL
3704
3705BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 128, 1, 12, ccm, CCM,
3706 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
3707 BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 192, 1, 12, ccm, CCM,
3708 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
3709 BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 256, 1, 12, ccm, CCM,
3710 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
3711
3712typedef struct {
3713 union {
3714 double align;
3715 AES_KEY ks;
3716 } ks;
3717 /* Indicates if IV has been set */
3718 unsigned char *iv;
3719} EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX;
3720
3721static int aes_wrap_init_key(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *key,
3722 const unsigned char *iv, int enc)
3723{
3724 EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX *wctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX,ctx);
3725 if (!iv && !key)
3726 return 1;
3727 if (key) {
3728 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx))
3729 AES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
3730 &wctx->ks.ks);
3731 else
3732 AES_set_decrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
3733 &wctx->ks.ks);
3734 if (!iv)
3735 wctx->iv = NULL;
3736 }
3737 if (iv) {
3738 memcpy(EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx), iv, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_length(ctx));
3739 wctx->iv = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(ctx);
3740 }
3741 return 1;
3742}
3743
3744static int aes_wrap_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
3745 const unsigned char *in, size_t inlen)
3746{
3747 EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX *wctx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX,ctx);
3748 size_t rv;
3749 /* AES wrap with padding has IV length of 4, without padding 8 */
3750 int pad = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_length(ctx) == 4;
3751 /* No final operation so always return zero length */
3752 if (!in)
3753 return 0;
3754 /* Input length must always be non-zero */
3755 if (!inlen)
3756 return -1;
3757 /* If decrypting need at least 16 bytes and multiple of 8 */
3758 if (!EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx) && (inlen < 16 || inlen & 0x7))
3759 return -1;
3760 /* If not padding input must be multiple of 8 */
3761 if (!pad && inlen & 0x7)
3762 return -1;
3763 if (is_partially_overlapping(out, in, inlen)) {
3764 EVPerr(EVP_F_AES_WRAP_CIPHER, EVP_R_PARTIALLY_OVERLAPPING);
3765 return 0;
3766 }
3767 if (!out) {
3768 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)) {
3769 /* If padding round up to multiple of 8 */
3770 if (pad)
3771 inlen = (inlen + 7) / 8 * 8;
3772 /* 8 byte prefix */
3773 return inlen + 8;
3774 } else {
3775 /*
3776 * If not padding output will be exactly 8 bytes smaller than
3777 * input. If padding it will be at least 8 bytes smaller but we
3778 * don't know how much.
3779 */
3780 return inlen - 8;
3781 }
3782 }
3783 if (pad) {
3784 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx))
3785 rv = CRYPTO_128_wrap_pad(&wctx->ks.ks, wctx->iv,
3786 out, in, inlen,
3787 (block128_f) AES_encrypt);
3788 else
3789 rv = CRYPTO_128_unwrap_pad(&wctx->ks.ks, wctx->iv,
3790 out, in, inlen,
3791 (block128_f) AES_decrypt);
3792 } else {
3793 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx))
3794 rv = CRYPTO_128_wrap(&wctx->ks.ks, wctx->iv,
3795 out, in, inlen, (block128_f) AES_encrypt);
3796 else
3797 rv = CRYPTO_128_unwrap(&wctx->ks.ks, wctx->iv,
3798 out, in, inlen, (block128_f) AES_decrypt);
3799 }
3800 return rv ? (int)rv : -1;
3801}
3802
3803#define WRAP_FLAGS (EVP_CIPH_WRAP_MODE \
3804 | EVP_CIPH_CUSTOM_IV | EVP_CIPH_FLAG_CUSTOM_CIPHER \
3805 | EVP_CIPH_ALWAYS_CALL_INIT | EVP_CIPH_FLAG_DEFAULT_ASN1)
3806
3807static const EVP_CIPHER aes_128_wrap = {
3808 NID_id_aes128_wrap,
3809 8, 16, 8, WRAP_FLAGS,
3810 aes_wrap_init_key, aes_wrap_cipher,
3811 NULL,
3812 sizeof(EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX),
3813 NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
3814};
3815
3816const EVP_CIPHER *EVP_aes_128_wrap(void)
3817{
3818 return &aes_128_wrap;
3819}
3820
3821static const EVP_CIPHER aes_192_wrap = {
3822 NID_id_aes192_wrap,
3823 8, 24, 8, WRAP_FLAGS,
3824 aes_wrap_init_key, aes_wrap_cipher,
3825 NULL,
3826 sizeof(EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX),
3827 NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
3828};
3829
3830const EVP_CIPHER *EVP_aes_192_wrap(void)
3831{
3832 return &aes_192_wrap;
3833}

3839 NULL,
3840 sizeof(EVP_AES_WRAP_CTX),
3841 NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL
3842};

3890
3891#ifndef OPENSSL_NO_OCB
3892static int aes_ocb_ctrl(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *c, int type, int arg, void *ptr)
3893{
3894 EVP_AES_OCB_CTX *octx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_OCB_CTX,c);
3895 EVP_CIPHER_CTX *newc;
3896 EVP_AES_OCB_CTX *new_octx;
3897
3898 switch (type) {
3899 case EVP_CTRL_INIT:
3900 octx->key_set = 0;
3901 octx->iv_set = 0;
3902 octx->ivlen = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_length(c);
3903 octx->iv = EVP_CIPHER_CTX_iv_noconst(c);
3904 octx->taglen = 16;
3905 octx->data_buf_len = 0;
3906 octx->aad_buf_len = 0;
3907 return 1;
3908
3909 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_SET_IVLEN:
3910 /* IV len must be 1 to 15 */
3911 if (arg <= 0 || arg > 15)
3912 return 0;
3913
3914 octx->ivlen = arg;
3915 return 1;
3916
3917 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_SET_TAG:
3918 if (!ptr) {
3919 /* Tag len must be 0 to 16 */
3920 if (arg < 0 || arg > 16)
3921 return 0;
3922
3923 octx->taglen = arg;
3924 return 1;
3925 }
3926 if (arg != octx->taglen || EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(c))
3927 return 0;
3928 memcpy(octx->tag, ptr, arg);
3929 return 1;
3930
3931 case EVP_CTRL_AEAD_GET_TAG:
3932 if (arg != octx->taglen || !EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(c))
3933 return 0;
3934
3935 memcpy(ptr, octx->tag, arg);
3936 return 1;
3937
3938 case EVP_CTRL_COPY:
3939 newc = (EVP_CIPHER_CTX *)ptr;
3940 new_octx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_OCB_CTX,newc);
3941 return CRYPTO_ocb128_copy_ctx(&new_octx->ocb, &octx->ocb,
3942 &new_octx->ksenc.ks,
3943 &new_octx->ksdec.ks);
3944
3945 default:
3946 return -1;
3947
3948 }
3949}
3950
3951# ifdef HWAES_CAPABLE
3952# ifdef HWAES_ocb_encrypt
3953void HWAES_ocb_encrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
3954 size_t blocks, const void *key,
3955 size_t start_block_num,
3956 unsigned char offset_i[16],
3957 const unsigned char L_[][16],
3958 unsigned char checksum[16]);
3959# else
3960# define HWAES_ocb_encrypt ((ocb128_f)NULL)
3961# endif
3962# ifdef HWAES_ocb_decrypt
3963void HWAES_ocb_decrypt(const unsigned char *in, unsigned char *out,
3964 size_t blocks, const void *key,
3965 size_t start_block_num,
3966 unsigned char offset_i[16],
3967 const unsigned char L_[][16],
3968 unsigned char checksum[16]);
3969# else
3970# define HWAES_ocb_decrypt ((ocb128_f)NULL)
3971# endif
3972# endif
3973
3974static int aes_ocb_init_key(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *key,
3975 const unsigned char *iv, int enc)
3976{
3977 EVP_AES_OCB_CTX *octx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_OCB_CTX,ctx);
3978 if (!iv && !key)
3979 return 1;
3980 if (key) {
3981 do {
3982 /*
3983 * We set both the encrypt and decrypt key here because decrypt
3984 * needs both. We could possibly optimise to remove setting the
3985 * decrypt for an encryption operation.
3986 */
3987# ifdef HWAES_CAPABLE
3988 if (HWAES_CAPABLE) {
3989 HWAES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
3990 &octx->ksenc.ks);
3991 HWAES_set_decrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
3992 &octx->ksdec.ks);
3993 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_init(&octx->ocb,
3994 &octx->ksenc.ks, &octx->ksdec.ks,
3995 (block128_f) HWAES_encrypt,
3996 (block128_f) HWAES_decrypt,
3997 enc ? HWAES_ocb_encrypt
3998 : HWAES_ocb_decrypt))
3999 return 0;
4000 break;
4001 }
4002# endif
4003# ifdef VPAES_CAPABLE
4004 if (VPAES_CAPABLE) {
4005 vpaes_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
4006 &octx->ksenc.ks);
4007 vpaes_set_decrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
4008 &octx->ksdec.ks);
4009 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_init(&octx->ocb,
4010 &octx->ksenc.ks, &octx->ksdec.ks,
4011 (block128_f) vpaes_encrypt,
4012 (block128_f) vpaes_decrypt,
4013 NULL))
4014 return 0;
4015 break;
4016 }
4017# endif
4018 AES_set_encrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
4019 &octx->ksenc.ks);
4020 AES_set_decrypt_key(key, EVP_CIPHER_CTX_key_length(ctx) * 8,
4021 &octx->ksdec.ks);
4022 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_init(&octx->ocb,
4023 &octx->ksenc.ks, &octx->ksdec.ks,
4024 (block128_f) AES_encrypt,
4025 (block128_f) AES_decrypt,
4026 NULL))
4027 return 0;
4028 }
4029 while (0);
4030
4031 /*
4032 * If we have an iv we can set it directly, otherwise use saved IV.
4033 */
4034 if (iv == NULL && octx->iv_set)
4035 iv = octx->iv;
4036 if (iv) {
4037 if (CRYPTO_ocb128_setiv(&octx->ocb, iv, octx->ivlen, octx->taglen)
4038 != 1)
4039 return 0;
4040 octx->iv_set = 1;
4041 }
4042 octx->key_set = 1;
4043 } else {
4044 /* If key set use IV, otherwise copy */
4045 if (octx->key_set)
4046 CRYPTO_ocb128_setiv(&octx->ocb, iv, octx->ivlen, octx->taglen);
4047 else
4048 memcpy(octx->iv, iv, octx->ivlen);
4049 octx->iv_set = 1;
4050 }
4051 return 1;
4052}
4053
4054static int aes_ocb_cipher(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
4055 const unsigned char *in, size_t len)
4056{
4057 unsigned char *buf;
4058 int *buf_len;
4059 int written_len = 0;
4060 size_t trailing_len;
4061 EVP_AES_OCB_CTX *octx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_OCB_CTX,ctx);
4062
4063 /* If IV or Key not set then return error */
4064 if (!octx->iv_set)
4065 return -1;
4066
4067 if (!octx->key_set)
4068 return -1;
4069
4070 if (in != NULL) {
4071 /*
4072 * Need to ensure we are only passing full blocks to low level OCB
4073 * routines. We do it here rather than in EVP_EncryptUpdate/
4074 * EVP_DecryptUpdate because we need to pass full blocks of AAD too
4075 * and those routines don't support that
4076 */
4077
4078 /* Are we dealing with AAD or normal data here? */
4079 if (out == NULL) {
4080 buf = octx->aad_buf;
4081 buf_len = &(octx->aad_buf_len);
4082 } else {
4083 buf = octx->data_buf;
4084 buf_len = &(octx->data_buf_len);
4085
4086 if (is_partially_overlapping(out + *buf_len, in, len)) {
4087 EVPerr(EVP_F_AES_OCB_CIPHER, EVP_R_PARTIALLY_OVERLAPPING);
4088 return 0;
4089 }
4090 }
4091
4092 /*
4093 * If we've got a partially filled buffer from a previous call then
4094 * use that data first
4095 */
4096 if (*buf_len > 0) {
4097 unsigned int remaining;
4098
4099 remaining = AES_BLOCK_SIZE - (*buf_len);
4100 if (remaining > len) {
4101 memcpy(buf + (*buf_len), in, len);
4102 *(buf_len) += len;
4103 return 0;
4104 }
4105 memcpy(buf + (*buf_len), in, remaining);
4106
4107 /*
4108 * If we get here we've filled the buffer, so process it
4109 */
4110 len -= remaining;
4111 in += remaining;
4112 if (out == NULL) {
4113 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_aad(&octx->ocb, buf, AES_BLOCK_SIZE))
4114 return -1;
4115 } else if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)) {
4116 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_encrypt(&octx->ocb, buf, out,
4117 AES_BLOCK_SIZE))
4118 return -1;
4119 } else {
4120 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_decrypt(&octx->ocb, buf, out,
4121 AES_BLOCK_SIZE))
4122 return -1;
4123 }
4124 written_len = AES_BLOCK_SIZE;
4125 *buf_len = 0;
4126 if (out != NULL)
4127 out += AES_BLOCK_SIZE;
4128 }
4129
4130 /* Do we have a partial block to handle at the end? */
4131 trailing_len = len % AES_BLOCK_SIZE;
4132
4133 /*
4134 * If we've got some full blocks to handle, then process these first
4135 */
4136 if (len != trailing_len) {
4137 if (out == NULL) {
4138 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_aad(&octx->ocb, in, len - trailing_len))
4139 return -1;
4140 } else if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)) {
4141 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_encrypt
4142 (&octx->ocb, in, out, len - trailing_len))
4143 return -1;
4144 } else {
4145 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_decrypt
4146 (&octx->ocb, in, out, len - trailing_len))
4147 return -1;
4148 }
4149 written_len += len - trailing_len;
4150 in += len - trailing_len;
4151 }
4152
4153 /* Handle any trailing partial block */
4154 if (trailing_len > 0) {
4155 memcpy(buf, in, trailing_len);
4156 *buf_len = trailing_len;
4157 }
4158
4159 return written_len;
4160 } else {
4161 /*
4162 * First of all empty the buffer of any partial block that we might
4163 * have been provided - both for data and AAD
4164 */
4165 if (octx->data_buf_len > 0) {
4166 if (EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)) {
4167 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_encrypt(&octx->ocb, octx->data_buf, out,
4168 octx->data_buf_len))
4169 return -1;
4170 } else {
4171 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_decrypt(&octx->ocb, octx->data_buf, out,
4172 octx->data_buf_len))
4173 return -1;
4174 }
4175 written_len = octx->data_buf_len;
4176 octx->data_buf_len = 0;
4177 }
4178 if (octx->aad_buf_len > 0) {
4179 if (!CRYPTO_ocb128_aad
4180 (&octx->ocb, octx->aad_buf, octx->aad_buf_len))
4181 return -1;
4182 octx->aad_buf_len = 0;
4183 }
4184 /* If decrypting then verify */
4185 if (!EVP_CIPHER_CTX_encrypting(ctx)) {
4186 if (octx->taglen < 0)
4187 return -1;
4188 if (CRYPTO_ocb128_finish(&octx->ocb,
4189 octx->tag, octx->taglen) != 0)
4190 return -1;
4191 octx->iv_set = 0;
4192 return written_len;
4193 }
4194 /* If encrypting then just get the tag */
4195 if (CRYPTO_ocb128_tag(&octx->ocb, octx->tag, 16) != 1)
4196 return -1;
4197 /* Don't reuse the IV */
4198 octx->iv_set = 0;
4199 return written_len;
4200 }
4201}
4202
4203static int aes_ocb_cleanup(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *c)
4204{
4205 EVP_AES_OCB_CTX *octx = EVP_C_DATA(EVP_AES_OCB_CTX,c);
4206 CRYPTO_ocb128_cleanup(&octx->ocb);
4207 return 1;
4208}
4209
4210BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 128, 16, 12, ocb, OCB,
4211 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
4212BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 192, 16, 12, ocb, OCB,
4213 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
4214BLOCK_CIPHER_custom(NID_aes, 256, 16, 12, ocb, OCB,
4215 EVP_CIPH_FLAG_AEAD_CIPHER | CUSTOM_FLAGS)
4216#endif /* OPENSSL_NO_OCB */
